name: Brivaracetam (Briviact)
summary: An anticonvulsant approved for the treatment of partial-onset seizures, sometimes used off-label in psychiatry for mood stabilization.
description: Brivaracetam is a high-affinity synaptic vesicle protein 2A (SV2A) ligand, structurally related to levetiracetam. It is primarily indicated for the treatment of partial-onset seizures in patients with epilepsy. Some emerging evidence suggests possible off-label uses in mood disorders, anxiety, and behavioral dysregulation, although this is not standard practice. Compared to levetiracetam, brivaracetam may have a lower incidence of behavioral side effects.

items: Partial-onset seizures in patients 4 years and older

sections.text: Binds selectively to synaptic vesicle protein 2A (SV2A), modulating neurotransmitter release and reducing neuronal hyperexcitability.

adult.titrate: Adjust in 25–50 mg increments as needed

sections.hepatic_impairment: Reduce dose by one-third in all stages
sections.renal_impairment: No adjustment for mild/moderate; use caution in severe

items: Tablets: 10 mg, 25 mg, 50 mg, 75 mg, 100 mg

sections.text: Onset within hours of dosing; steady-state reached in 2 days with twice-daily dosing.

other: Monitor for psychiatric symptoms including irritability, aggression, and suicidal thoughts
Use caution in patients with history of psychiatric disorders

sections.pregnancy: Use if benefits outweigh risks; registry enrollment encouraged
sections.lactation: Unknown if excreted in breast milk; use caution
sections.geriatrics: Generally well tolerated; monitor for CNS effects

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over 1–2 weeks to minimize seizure risk.

items: May be better tolerated than levetiracetam in patients who experience behavioral side effects
